roleset.name: move, come to

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: But with the index proving somewhat better than expected and the widely anticipated report on October employment scheduled to arrive tomorrow, stock prices firmed only modestly in response to the report and then faltered.
example.arg: the widely anticipated report on October

example.name: with end point, destination
example.text: When he arrived in the U.S. in 1969 -- the start of an eight-year tour -- he tried selling Japanese yen-denominated bonds to U.S. investors.
example.arg: in 1969 -- the start of an eight-year tour --

example.name: ARG1 and ARG3
example.text: But as Tan Zhiqiang points out , nearly a quarter of the residents of Macau have arrived from the mainland during the past ten years .
example.arg: nearly a quarter of the residents of Macau

example.name: Example with rare arg 3
example.text: the arrival of cocoa from the interior

example.name: Example with arg 4
example.text: the arrival on the market of $ 4.52 billion in 30-year bondsoffered by the Resolution Funding Corp. as part of the government's bailout of the savings and loan industry
example.arg: of $ 4.52 billion in 30-year bondsoffered by the Resolution Funding Corp. as part of the government's bailout of the savings and loan industry

example.name: Very common instance of having only arg 1
example with all but arg 2
example.text: On our arrival from Waterloo at Allgate

roleset.note: ARRIVE-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Comparison to 'come'. Member of VNcls escape-51.1-2. (from arrive.01-v)
ARRIVAL-N NOTES: Roleset based on arrive.01. Verbnet class 51.1-2, framenet class arriving. Framed by Katie. (from arrival.01-n)
